data.title: ONE Championship hopeful Yunusov thanks Anatoly Malykhin after KO and bonus in Bangkok
data.description: Rustam Yunusov has thanked Anatoly Malykhin and the two-division ONE Championship MMA champ’s wife after another big victory in Bangkok.

data.title: ONE Championship ‘honoured’ by Eliud Kipchoge’s presence for Friday Fights 89 at Lumpinee Stadium
data.description: Marathon legend Eliud Kipchoge was the star guest for another action-packed night full of knockouts and bonuses at ONE Friday Fights 89 in Bangkok.

data.title: Bangkok postpones plan to close major road
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has postponed plans to close the elevated road on Rama IX from Dec 2 this year until further notice.

data.title: Nation Foundation offers assistance to South flood victims
data.description: The "Nation Shares Compassion to Aid Flood Victims" initiative, organised by the Nation Foundation in collaboration with southern community aid networks and private sector partners, aims to support those affected by the recent flooding.

data.title: 14 charter change bills set for debate on House return
data.description: A total of 14 bills partially amending the 2017 constitution are set to be deliberated when the House reconvenes next month, Speaker Wan Muhamad Noor Matha said on Friday.

data.title: 14 charter change bills set for debate on House return
data.description: A total of 14 bills partially amending the 2017 constitution are set to be deliberated when the House reconvenes next month, the speaker Wan Muhamad Noor Matha said yesterday.

data.title: ONE Championship’s new grappling star Dante Leon feels ‘no pressure to fill Mikey Musumeci void’
data.description: ONE Championship’s latest grappling star signing Dante Leon insists he feels “no pressure to fill a void left by Mikey Musumeci”.

data.title: Explainer: How govt plans to fund the THB20 flat train fare
data.description: Around THB16 billion required to expand the rate to all train routes from September 2025

data.title: ONE Championship: Nabil says kickboxing is ‘easier than Muay Thai’, plans ‘something special’ for Petchtanong
data.description: Nabil Anane admits he is the underdog against “master” Petchtanong Petchfergus at ONE Fight Night 26 next week in Bangkok – but feels kickboxing is “easier than Muay Thai”, and warns the former champ he has “something special” planned.

data.title: Syrian rebels breach city of Aleppo, in biggest advance in years
data.description: ALEPPO — Syrian rebels breached the major city of Aleppo on Friday, according to the fighters and a war monitor, raising fears that the nation

data.title: Five booming businesses driving Phuket’s land prices sky high
data.description: Developer Sansiri plans to invest 25 billion baht in 27 new projects in the next five years

data.title: MRC Council reaffirms commitment to regional cooperation
data.description: The Mekong River Commission's policy-making body met today in Luang Prabang to review progress, address the growing challenges facing the Mekong River Basin, and re-commit to regional cooperation.

data.title: Notre Dame Cathedral unveils its new interior 5 years after devastating fire
data.description: PARIS (AP) — After more than five years of frenetic, but sometimes interrupted, reconstruction work, Notre Dame Cathedral showed itself anew to the world Friday, with rebuilt soaring ceilings and creamy good-as-new stonework erasing somber memories of its devastating fire in 2019.

data.title: Cabinet approves THB641 million for post-flood rehabilitation in North
data.description: The Cabinet on Friday approved 641.13 million baht for flood rehabilitation projects in Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai provinces in a bid to boost the confidence of travellers during the high tourism season.

data.title: Agoda, Thai Government unite to inspire Thailand's future tech leaders
data.description: Agoda partners with MHESI to upskill Thai students and teach them real-world tech applications in a corporate setting. The initiative aims to inspire further studies and careers in tech, fostering innovation and future leadership across Thailand.

data.title: Notre Dame Cathedral unveils its new interior 5 years after devastating fire
data.description: PARIS (AP) — After more than five years of frenetic, but sometimes interrupted, reconstruction work, Notre Dame Cathedral showed itself anew to the world Friday, with rebuilt soaring ceilings and creamy good-as-new stonework erasing somber memories of its devastating fire in 2019.

data.title: SIA passenger with fractured spine in turbulence recovers, walks again
data.description: Malaysian undergraduate Hong Mun Ying had been aboard the ill-fated SIA flight scheduled to fly from London to Singapore on May 21 but was diverted to Bangkok after it encountered extreme turbulence over the Irrawaddy Basin in Myanmar.

data.title: Singapore Airlines passenger who fractured spine in turbulence-hit flight gets back on her feet
data.description: Malaysian undergraduate Hong Mun Ying had been aboard the ill-fated SIA flight scheduled to fly from London to Singapore on May 21 but was diverted to Bangkok after it encountered extreme turbulence over the Irrawaddy Basin in Myanmar.

data.title: Chinese EV companies set to shine at Thailand expo
data.description: Chinese electric vehicle brands are among the most anticipated participants at the 41st Bangkok International Motor Expo, which kicks off on Friday.

data.title: Thailand, US to resume direct flights
data.description: Thailand and the United States are expected to resume direct flights in February of next year when the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) of the US Department of Transportation upgrades Thai aviation safety from Category 2 to Category 1, according to Deputy Prime Minister and Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit.

data.title: Formaldehyde found in e-cig samples, dept says
data.description: The Department of Disease Control (DDC) has warned that formaldehyde was found in samples of e-cigarette liquids sold illegally in Thailand and that the aerosol of the chemical can cause cancer.

data.title: BMA postpones plan to close major road
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has postponed plans to close the elevated road on Rama IX from Dec 2 this year until further notice.

data.title: Fast progress in Chiang Rai rail project
data.description: The construction of a new railway project with four tunnels designed to withstand the impact of natural disasters in Chiang Rai has progressed by 20%, said the Department of Rail Transport

data.title: There's plenty for Thai star Jeeno to smile about
data.description: It has been both a triumphant and lucrative week for Thailand

data.title: PM urges people not to protest over sea border row
data.description: The government yesterday urged people not to take to the streets over the controversial 2001 Thailand-Cambodia memorandum of understanding (MoU) on joint development in the Gulf of Thailand, saying Thailand would not lose an inch of its territory to Cambodia.

data.title: Thai shuttlers stay on course in Lucknow
data.description: Mixed doubles pair Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Supissara Paewsampran and women

data.title: Port progress, Kirins revive ACL 2 hopes
data.description: Thai League 1 giants Port sealed progression to the knockout stage of the AFC Champions League Two after a 2-2 draw with Persib Bandung in Group F on Thursday night at BG Stadium.

data.title: B19bn to fix two northern provinces
data.description: The government has approved 19 billion baht to fix infrastructure and utilities in Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai following the recent heavy floods, government spokesman Jirayu Houngsub said.

data.title: Tourism and private consumption boost Thailand’s economy: BOT
data.description: Government’s cash handout scheme has contributed to rising consumption

data.title: Picket over land loss decrees
data.description: About 5,000 members of the assembly of the people living in community forests stormed Chiang Mai City Hall on Friday, demanding the government stop the implementation of the royal decrees on conserving and protecting natural resources in national parks and wildlife reserves as the laws will have a severe impact on the way of life of their communities.

data.title: Govt revs up flood aid in South
data.description: The government is stepping up efforts to help flood victims in several provinces in the South as more than 240,000 households were hit by severe flooding triggered by days of heavy rainfall.

data.title: Macron hails Notre-Dame restoration
data.description: PARIS - French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday praised the more than 1,000 artisans who helped rebuild  Notre-Dame  Cathedral in what he called “the project of the century”, five-and-a-half years after fire gutted the Gothic masterpiece.

data.title: British lawmakers vote to legalise assisted dying
data.description: LONDON - Britain’s parliament has voted in favour of a new bill to legalise  assisted dying , paving the way for months of further debate on an issue that has divided the country and raised questions about the standard of palliative care.

data.title: 20-baht transit fare extended for 2025
data.description: The cabinet has approved a budget of 400 million baht to support the extension of the  20-baht flat fare  for the Red and Purple  electric train  lines for another year.
